hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Neutral Reversion via Funding Rate Normalization
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, when aggregate perpetual swap funding rates across major exchanges revert from extremes (>|0.05%| daily) to neutral band (-0.01% to 0.01%) while BTC price stabilizes within ±2% over 3 days, the regime will transition to NEUTRAL within the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme funding rates during stress indicate excessive leverage positioning. Normalization combined with price stabilization suggests deleveraging completion and reduction of forced liquidations, creating conditions for regime normalization.
entry_conditions: Current daily funding rate between -0.01% and 0.01%
Volume decline >20% from stress period peak

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Funding rates return to >|0.05%| or price breaks >5% from stabilization range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of such setups result in NEUTRAL regime within 10 days, or funding normalization proves to be a continuation pattern rather than reversal signal.
